es.us.alumn.miggoncan2.model.entities

Class DayConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.us.alumn.miggoncan2.model.entities.DayConfiguration

  • @Entity
public class DayConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    This Entity represents a specific conditions to take into account when creating the schedule for a certain day of a Calendar Moreover, a DayConfiguration can be used to express one-time additions to the current ShiftConfiguration. For example, a DayConfiguration can specify a certain Doctor would like to take their shift this day. Another example of the use of this entity would be to specify a Doctor is not available this day and, therefore, no shift should be assigned to them this day This DayConfiguration will have higher priority than the current ShiftConfiguration. For example, if a Doctor is has the "Monday" shift configured as unavailable, but one certain day they would like to take this shift, the wantedShifts can be used to indicate it. Important: A DayConfiguration should not be used as a substitute to ShiftConfiguration, but as a way to express a one-off change Note the primary key of DayConfiguration is composite, as indicated by the IdClass annotation. Moreover a DayConfiguration receives the month and year of its primary key from its corresponding associated Calendar
    Author:
    miggoncan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Calendar calendar 
      private java.util.List<CycleChange> cycleChanges
      cycleChanges indicates a change that should be done to the cycle-shifts of this day when creating its schedule
      private @Range(min=1L,max=31L) java.lang.Integer day 
      private @NotNull java.lang.Boolean isWorkingDay
      isWorkingDay should be set to false not only for weekends, but for holidays as well
      private java.util.List<Doctor> mandatoryShifts
      mandatoryShifts indicates the Doctors that HAVE to have a shift this day
      private @Range(min=1L,max=12L) java.lang.Integer month 
      private @PositiveOrZero @NotNull java.lang.Integer numConsultations
      numConsultations indicates the number of consultations that will be scheduled for this day
      private @PositiveOrZero @NotNull java.lang.Integer numShifts
      numShifts indicates the number of non-cycle-shifts that will be scheduled for this day Note numConsultations is counted separetly
      private java.util.List<Doctor> unavailableShifts
      unavailableShifts indicates the Doctors that cannot, in any way, have a shift this day
      private java.util.List<Doctor> unwantedShifts
      unwantedShifts indicates the Doctors that would rather not have a shift this day
      private java.util.List<Doctor> wantedShifts
      wantedShifts indicates the Doctors that would like to have one of their corresponding shifts this day
      private @Range(min=1970L) java.lang.Integer year
